title: sync client doesn't upload to external storages
body:
i tried this with the stable5 branch and the sync client 1.2.5 on gnu/linux.

for the local storage everything works fine but it seems like the sync client doesn't upload files to external storages.

i mounted a external webdav storages into the sync client directory ("clientsync/mount"). the files are synced to the client just fine but if i modify the files on the client  the modifications never appear on the server. adding a new file to the folder result in an empty file on the server.

i assume that this has something to do with the way we are handling the .part files on upload. i discovered this behaviour while working on the encryption app where i also tried to use the .part extensions for files not completely encrypted&uploaded.

my assumption is: because the file cache ignores these files this files never exist for the external storage back-end and therefore they are not handled correctly.

apache error log:

```
[tue jun 18 15:48:53 2013] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] resource not found.
[tue jun 18 15:48:53 2013] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] resource not found.
[tue jun 18 15:48:54 2013] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] resource not found.
[tue jun 18 15:48:55 2013] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] resource not found.
[tue jun 18 15:48:55 2013] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] resource not found.
[tue jun 18 15:48:55 2013] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] resource not found.
[tue jun 18 15:48:55 2013] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] resource not found.
[tue jun 18 15:48:55 2013] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] resource not found.
```

owncloud.log:

```
{"app":"webdav client","message":"resource not found.","level":3,"time":1371471618}
```

cc @butonic if i remember correctly you implemented the .part files on the server side, right? could you have a look at it? thanks!
